intro: Stilpnophleum laguroides, commonly known as the Laguroides spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often striking floral structures. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while the flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences. Stilpnophleum laguroides is adapted to arid conditions, showing resilience to drought and nutrient-poor soils.
